intent: Define the action of the deviation operator δ on the irreducible primitive values (0, 1, ±, ∞, ⊥, ⊤) to bridge Tier-00 primitives into the Tier-01 δ-layer.
description: These rules specify how the δ deviation operator acts on semantic primitives. They form the canonical bridge between Tier-00 primitive values and the Tier-01 δ-family, and are to be included as a base case in any δ-based rewrite system.

constraints: δ cannot create structure out of pure null.

rules.semantic\_intent: Unit state has zero internal gradient.
constraints: δ measures change; identity has no internal change.

rules.semantic\_intent: Primitive polarity is the first non-null deviation; δ preserves this orientation.
constraints: δ acts as identity on pure polarity seeds.

rules.semantic\_intent: Uniform infinite extent has no local deviation; all points see the same state.
constraints: Non-uniform infinities must be represented at higher tiers, not as primitive ∞.
rules.pseudocode: if x \== '∞': return 0 \# under Ω-regularized uniformity

rules.semantic\_intent: Contradiction is absorbing; deviation cannot resolve or alter it.
constraints: ⊥ is the boundary of semantic consistency.
No δ action can escape ⊥ without explicit paraconsistent rules at Θ/Ω tiers.

rules.semantic\_intent: Tautology is maximally consistent and uniform; no internal deviation remains.
constraints: δ measures local change; tautology is invariant under such change.

normal\_form\_notes: For primitive arguments, δ always rewrites to a primitive value.
No higher δ-structure (e.g. δᵢ, δ², δᴶ) is introduced at the primitive level.
These rules must be applied before any Tier-01+ composite δ rules.
